They are in these words- Without prejudice to the general application of section 24 of the U.P. General Clauses Act, 1904, every numberification imposing cess issued and every assessment made  including the amount of cess companylected  under or in pursuance of any such numberification, shall be deemed a numberification issued, assess- ment made and cess companylected under this Act as if sections 2, 3 and 5 to 8 had been in force at all material dates. arguments.claim: Factory premises not local area; local area is area administered by local body like municipality

anchor.surface_text: We are of opinion that the proper meaning to be attached to the words local area in Entry 52 of the Constitution, when the area is a part of the State imposing the law is an area administered by a local body like a municipality, a district board, a local board, a union board, a Panchayat or the like. The premises of a factory is therefore not a local area.

arguments.claim: Local area in Art 277 supports meaning as area with local authority

anchor.surface_text: The only other part of the Constitution where the word local area appears is in Art. 277. That Article is in these words- Any taxes, duties, cesses or fees which, immediately before the commencement of this Constitution, were being lawfully levied by the Government of any State or by any municipality or other local authority or body for the purposes of the State, municipality, district, or other local area

holdings.text: The proper meaning to be attached to the words 'local area' in Entry 52 of the Constitution, when the area is a part of the State imposing the law, is an area administered by a local body like a municipality, a district board, a local board, a union board, a Panchayat or the like.

anchor.surface_text: We are of opinion that the proper meaning to be attached to the words local area in Entry 52 of the Constitution, when the area is a part of the State imposing the law is an area administered by a local body like a municipality, a district board, a local board, a union board, a Panchayat or the like.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Based on ordinary meaning, legislative history from GIA 1935 Entry 49, octroi duties on areas administered by local authorities, and harmonious construction with Art. 277.

holdings.text: The premises of a factory is therefore not a local area.

anchor.surface_text: The premises of a factory is therefore not a local area.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Direct application of definition of 'local area' to factory premises.

holdings.text: Section 3 of the U.P. Sugarcane Cess Act, 1956, empowering the imposition of cess on entry of sugarcane into premises of a factory did not fall within Entry 52 of the State List.

anchor.surface_text: It must therefore be held that s. 3 of the U. P. Sugarcane Cess Act, 1956, empowering the Governor to impose a cess on the entry of sugarcane into the premises of a factory did not fall within Entry 52 of the State List.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Factory premises not local area under Entry 52.

holdings.text: The law as enacted in s. 3 of the U.P. Sugarcane Cess Act, 1956, was beyond the legislative competence of the State Legislature and must be struck down as invalid.

anchor.surface_text: As there is no other Entry in either State List or Concurrent List in which the impugned law could fall there is no escape from the conclusion that this law was beyond the legislative competence of the State Legislature.

holdings.reasoning_summary: No other list entry covers the levy; ultra vires on competence.

holdings.text: This is not a case where the law is in two parts such that one part can be severed and saved while striking down the invalid portion.

anchor.surface_text: It may be mentioned that this is not a case where the law is in two parts and one part can be severed from the other and saved as valid while striking down the other portion which is invalid.

holdings.reasoning_summary: No suggestion of severance by respondents; cannot rewrite law.

holdings.text: It is unnecessary to consider whether section 3 has gone beyond the permissible limits of delegated legislation.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Legislation already invalid on competence ground.

holdings.text: The view in Emperor v. Munnalal is not authority for the proposition that the area of one single factory is a local area within the meaning of Entry 52.

holdings.text: Words conferring legislative power should be interpreted liberally but not stretched beyond reasonable connotation.

anchor.surface_text: In considering the meaning of the words local area in entry 52 we have, on the one hand to bear in mind the salutary rule that words conferring the right of legislation should be interpreted liberally and the powers conferred should be given the widest amplitude

holdings.reasoning_summary: Affirmed prior precedents like Gwyer CJ and Das J, but limits apply.

holdings.text: Presumption of constitutionality does not extend the limits of powers granted by Constitution.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Presumption resolves doubts in favor of legislature but cannot expand powers.

anchor.surface_text: BY COURT. In accordance with the opinion of the majority the appeal is allowed, the order passed by the High Court is set aside and a writ be issued directing that the respondents do forbear from levying and collecting cess from the appellants on account of arrears of cess for the crushing season 1954-55 and successive crushing seasons under the Uttar Pradesh Sugarcane Cess Act, 1956.
